meanings.definition: A dense group of people or objects
meanings.sent1: The children formed a ruck around the teacher during storytime.
meanings.sent2: The fans created a ruck as they rushed towards the stage.
meanings.sent3: The ruck of colorful balloons made the party even more festive.
meanings.sent4: In the busy market, shoppers moved like a ruck of ants.
meanings.sent5: The ruck of fallen leaves covered the entire sidewalk.

meanings.definition: A fold or wrinkle in fabric
meanings.sent1: She smoothed out the ruck in her dress before the party.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully ironed out the ruck in the shirt.
meanings.sent3: The ruck in the tablecloth looked like a tiny mountain.
meanings.sent4: The old map had a ruck that obscured part of the coastline.
meanings.sent5: The ruck in the curtain created interesting shadows in the room.

meanings.definition: To gather or form into a dense group
meanings.sent1: The students decided to ruck together for a group project.
meanings.sent2: Let's ruck all the chairs in the center for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to ruck all their toys into one big pile.
meanings.sent4: She managed to ruck all the scattered papers into a neat stack.
meanings.sent5: The team will ruck near the finish line for a group photo.

meanings.definition: A rough or disorderly fight or scuffle
meanings.sent1: The boys got into a ruck over who won the game.
meanings.sent2: The street was chaotic with the ruck between rival gangs.
meanings.sent3: The ruck between the puppies over the toy was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The political debate turned into a verbal ruck between the candidates.
meanings.sent5: The ruck in the schoolyard was quickly broken up by the teachers.
